This patch introduces a way to parse cpuset information by looking

commit_message:
Introduce os-capability parsing

This patch introduces a way to parse cpuset information by looking
into the 'lscpu' output. The implementation is presently done for
linux but given docker or some such container runtimes can work on
other operating systems too, a more generic approach has been taken.

Eventually host_capabilities module should expose general purpose
methods leaving the details of the os inside the respective dir.

Change-Id: I0f92594d8e5ce013f47174c09bc941ea1de3f0a8

subject: Use RDO/UCA everywhere
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-10 11:15:07.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/pre_install.yml', 'vars/redhat.yml', 'vars/ubuntu-14.04.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/use-uca-everywhere-4be33314d01c8545.yaml', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Use RDO/UCA everywhere

The pip_install role installs binary dependencies, like python-openssl
(on Ubuntu), or pyOpenSSL (on Centos).

By default, we didn't configure extra sources (like UCA or RDO)
in the pip_install role. Because the repo is built using UCA or RDO
(current default), we could have inconsistency issues:
containers that haven't UCA or RDO applied during their role execution
would run with a venv packaged for a different python-openssl
(or python-cryptography).

This commit brings the consistency by installing UCA/RDO everywhere.

Closes-Bug: 1624791

Change-Id: I9b5cd40b2972c93af348d4ddfde21a038cf9becc
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
(Manually cherry picked from commit
fe4fa1882229c22478357c82a71a4227d868b8c5)
"}]
commit_message:
Use RDO/UCA everywhere

The pip_install role installs binary dependencies, like python-openssl
(on Ubuntu), or pyOpenSSL (on Centos).

By default, we didn't configure extra sources (like UCA or RDO)
in the pip_install role. Because the repo is built using UCA or RDO
(current default), we could have inconsistency issues:
containers that haven't UCA or RDO applied during their role execution
would run with a venv packaged for a different python-openssl
(or python-cryptography).

This commit brings the consistency by installing UCA/RDO everywhere.

Closes-Bug: 1624791

Change-Id: I9b5cd40b2972c93af348d4ddfde21a038cf9becc
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
(Manually cherry picked from commit
fe4fa1882229c22478357c82a71a4227d868b8c5)

commit_message:
undercloud upgrade: stop httpd

httpd needs to be in the list of things we want to stop because it runs
OpenStack APIs.

For example, in Ocata we are removing Nova API in WSGI and run in
eventlet again like it was done in Mitaka.

Change-Id: I610fbf1373363bab107d52b9085081b6de11f58d

subject: Add start_version check for do_list() image_metadata option
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 00:42:23.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/v3/shell.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/v3/test_shell.py'], 'message': 'Add start_version check for do_list() image_metadata option

The image_metadata options requires Cinder API v3.4, but
user can specify this option before API v3.4 then the
option will be ignored without any warning message.

We should check this option using start_version to
avoid confusion.

Change-Id: I6983494cb6653a9eaf35f4eedba87aeb70b55260
'}]
commit_message:
Add start_version check for do_list() image_metadata option

The image_metadata options requires Cinder API v3.4, but
user can specify this option before API v3.4 then the
option will be ignored without any warning message.

We should check this option using start_version to
avoid confusion.

Change-Id: I6983494cb6653a9eaf35f4eedba87aeb70b55260

subject: Add --metadata option to API v2 cinder list command again
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1736, 'name': 'Ivan Kolodyazhny', 'email': 'e0ne@e0ne.info', 'username': 'e0ne'}, {'_account_id': 5997, 'name': 'Walt', 'display_name': 'Hemna', 'email': 'waboring@hemna.com', 'username': 'walter-boring', 'status': 'SAP'}, {'_account_id': 7173, 'name': 'Scott DAngelo', 'email': 'scott.dangelo@gmail.com', 'username': 'scottda'}, {'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 9236, 'name': 'Jon Bernard', 'email': 'jobernar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jbernard'}, {'_account_id': 10115, 'name': 'Mitsuhiro Tanino', 'email': 'mittjp1129@gmail.com', 'username': 'mtanino'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 23602, 'name': 'Michael Dovgal', 'email': 'dovgalmichael@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdovgal'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-03 19:42:05.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/v3/shell.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py', 'cinderclient/v2/shell.py'], 'message': 'Add --metadata option to API v2 cinder list command again

In the commit I90a2b713556e91db69270a03ef6b798e08f93f90,
--metadata option of do_list() in v2/shell.py was
unexpectedly removed and --image_metadata option was
added instead of --metadata option.

This is wrong fix because --image_metadata option
requires API version >= "3.4" and is not supported at
API v2. On the other hands, --metadata option of
do_list() is supported from API v1.

We should remove --image_metadata option and then add
--metadata option to do_list() again.

Also comment on API v3 cinder list --metadata should
be fixed because this doesn't require API >=3.4.

Co-Authored-By: Masaki Kimura <masaki.kimura.kz@hitachi.com>

Change-Id: Ic7d5cfa2acb47fbf73776e034d958ad8fb9119a8
Closes-Bug: #1661045
'}]
commit_message:
Add --metadata option to API v2 cinder list command again

In the commit I90a2b713556e91db69270a03ef6b798e08f93f90,
--metadata option of do_list() in v2/shell.py was
unexpectedly removed and --image_metadata option was
added instead of --metadata option.

This is wrong fix because --image_metadata option
requires API version >= "3.4" and is not supported at
API v2. On the other hands, --metadata option of
do_list() is supported from API v1.

We should remove --image_metadata option and then add
--metadata option to do_list() again.

Also comment on API v3 cinder list --metadata should
be fixed because this doesn't require API >=3.4.

Co-Authored-By: Masaki Kimura <masaki.kimura.kz@hitachi.com>

Change-Id: Ic7d5cfa2acb47fbf73776e034d958ad8fb9119a8
Closes-Bug: #1661045

commit_message:
Adds network check in upgrade phase in devstack

When running grenade with multitenancy, we are able to boot instances
in the network neutron has created in its upgrade phase, and we don't
have to change that setup.

Change-Id: I1038548ad4f93788fca3e2b7dd8ed93da0ce7702

subject: Ensures the host IP isn't used for containers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-10 13:49:42.000000000', 'files': ['etc/openstack_deploy/openstack_user_config.yml.aio'], 'message': "Ensures the host IP isn't used for containers

We statically configure the host IP for many networks during the
bootstrap AIO process. Later, when the inventory is generated,
we use an IP from the queue, which could be conflicting with the
host (Probability: 1 on 204).

This should fix it.

Change-Id: I5a49eebef48892d7266684f1ffdbe1d08d82c211
(cherry picked from commit 96c766004de478f08026754e3d0443ebf8b6f467)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensures the host IP isn't used for containers

We statically configure the host IP for many networks during the
bootstrap AIO process. Later, when the inventory is generated,
we use an IP from the queue, which could be conflicting with the
host (Probability: 1 on 204).

This should fix it.

Change-Id: I5a49eebef48892d7266684f1ffdbe1d08d82c211
(cherry picked from commit 96c766004de478f08026754e3d0443ebf8b6f467)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-10 04:34:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/conf/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_tc_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_ip_lib.py', 'neutron/common/utils.py', 'neutron/tests/fullstack/resources/client.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/test_tc_lib.py', 'etc/neutron/rootwrap.d/linuxbridge-plugin.filters', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/extension_drivers/qos_driver.py', 'doc/source/devref/quality_of_service.rst', 'neutron/tests/fullstack/test_qos.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/tc_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/extension_drivers/test_qos_driver.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Linux Bridge: driver support for QoS egress minimum bandwidth"

This reverts commit 84b3ae3ae9111e241352bdccad238c9fd37b83df.

The logic was incorrect[1]. We cannot achieve QoS egress minimum bandwidth of Linuxbridge by the patch. I also think that the issue is not solved by small patch and we must consider deeply.

Closes-bug: 1662582

(cherry picked from commit e3063496cfc6fa39ac6d2b76da0d876c8dfdebd2)

Change-Id: Id4703b5c63876f16e31b6805cd147b5840a4a591
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Linux Bridge: driver support for QoS egress minimum bandwidth"

This reverts commit 84b3ae3ae9111e241352bdccad238c9fd37b83df.

The logic was incorrect[1]. We cannot achieve QoS egress minimum bandwidth of Linuxbridge by the patch. I also think that the issue is not solved by small patch and we must consider deeply.

Closes-bug: 1662582

(cherry picked from commit e3063496cfc6fa39ac6d2b76da0d876c8dfdebd2)

Change-Id: Id4703b5c63876f16e31b6805cd147b5840a4a591

subject: Remove dist/ directory
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-02-07 18:03:26.000000000', 'files': ['webpack.config.js', 'src/index.html', 'config/tripleo_ui_config.js.sample', 'docs/installation.rst'], 'message': "Remove dist/ directory

* Move dist/index.html to src/
* Move dist/tripleo_ui_config.js.samle to config/
* Use html webpack plugin to generate dist/index.html on build
* Update documentation

Reasons:

* The dist/ dir conflicts with Python builds in CI
* Semantically, having the two files in that directory doesn't make sense

Closes-bug: 1661261
Change-Id: I0904e9e5c2ced12865611fab21ee1f66d33d52bb
"}]
commit_message:
Remove dist/ directory

* Move dist/index.html to src/
* Move dist/tripleo_ui_config.js.samle to config/
* Use html webpack plugin to generate dist/index.html on build
* Update documentation

Reasons:

* The dist/ dir conflicts with Python builds in CI
* Semantically, having the two files in that directory doesn't make sense

Closes-bug: 1661261
Change-Id: I0904e9e5c2ced12865611fab21ee1f66d33d52bb

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-02-10 03:25:58.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/quickstart/multinode-settings.yml', 'toci_gate_test.sh'], 'message': "Enable Debug: True on OVB jobs

Debug should be enabled in CI, and there is never enough logs to help in
debugging and solving complex problems.
We should not use the default value in TripleO and override it in CI to
let our developers debugging correctly.

Note: it's already enabled for multinode jobs.

Change-Id: I219214c8a77f35fcd41414b3d83b3ebb84c4cb0f
"}]
commit_message:
Enable Debug: True on OVB jobs

Debug should be enabled in CI, and there is never enough logs to help in
debugging and solving complex problems.
We should not use the default value in TripleO and override it in CI to
let our developers debugging correctly.

Note: it's already enabled for multinode jobs.

Change-Id: I219214c8a77f35fcd41414b3d83b3ebb84c4cb0f

commit_message:
Remove legacy major upgrade scripts for Ceph and BlockStorage

We do not need the upgrade scripts used to migrate Ceph from
hammer to jewel. This submission removes that and the legacy
upgrade scripts used for the BlockStorage role.

Change-Id: I2674216dd9b5b849de6a2624ee1115420a254182

commit_message:
Remove heat as enable_service in devstack

Now that heat is available as a devstack plugin, we should
use it. In-tree devstack code for heat is planned to be
removed soon.

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-02-08 07:11:24.000000000', 'files': ['doc/config-reference/source/block-storage/drivers/quobyte-driver.rst'], 'message': 'Switch Nova Quobyte volume driver to rely on externally provided client mount.

This change updates the Block Storage service documentation regarding a change
in the Nova driver.
In order to prevent systemd from unmounting volumes mounted by the
Quobyte Nova driver the clients operations are removed from this driver and
provided by external configuration.

Partial-Bug: #1530860

Depends-On: I9ddd6d2cc67c67b488a0cbf88d2ab124c7a82cca
Change-Id: I97e508b312dcaa594d16f9c162588ba10ed3eed3
'}]
commit_message:
Switch Nova Quobyte volume driver to rely on externally provided client mount.

This change updates the Block Storage service documentation regarding a change
in the Nova driver.
In order to prevent systemd from unmounting volumes mounted by the
Quobyte Nova driver the clients operations are removed from this driver and
provided by external configuration.

Partial-Bug: #1530860

Depends-On: I9ddd6d2cc67c67b488a0cbf88d2ab124c7a82cca
Change-Id: I97e508b312dcaa594d16f9c162588ba10ed3eed3

subject: Remove support for py34
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 04:21:59.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Id2e67b9b8ffa696c75468801226143912f761c29
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Id2e67b9b8ffa696c75468801226143912f761c29

commit_message:
Switch Nova Quobyte volume driver to rely on external client mount.

In order to prevent systemd from unmounting volumes mounted by the
Quobyte driver the clients operations are removed from this driver and
provided by external configuration.
This removes u-/mount.quobyte operations from the driver. The driver remains
to validate volume availability and provide e.g. location info regarding
volumes.

This also fixes the Cinder related Quobyte CIs who currently fail.

Partial-Bug: #1530860
Closes-Bug: #1508791

The documentation change is done in commit
    bd4092b48ce03f64e24c7126234c7ea79890ce09

Change-Id: I9ddd6d2cc67c67b488a0cbf88d2ab124c7a82cca

commit_message:
tempest: Disable compute-feature-enabled.swap_volume for ceph

Initially enabled by Ibb6b3095 the swap_volume feature is not supported
when using the ceph cinder volume backend due to rbd not providing any
host device to rebase into.

Change-Id: Id6d3616c4e879555e05e14fc9a310c57e953a7f2
Closes-bug: #1660919

commit_message:
ensure that tripleo-quickstart volume pool is defined

I wanted to suggest an alternative to the solution proposed in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/421467/, but I was too late.  This
change reduces the three tasks added in #421467 to a single task,
since defining a volume pool is idempotent.  We don't need to check if
is already defined or not first.

This also corrects the fact that the previous changes are checking for
the existence of an XML file that libvirt doesn't actually care about.

Change-Id: I726b89e4bbda18c9648ce52da12b2728a232e00c

commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: I36589d18f80d1681e27312cf0f8a1e12dbc8e74a
(cherry picked from commit 207a3aa7ebdac6fd03869598a98b068b7113d61c)

subject: Send service token along with user tokens
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-02-10 14:38:55.000000000', 'files': ['specs/pike/approved/use-service-tokens.rst'], 'message': "Send service token along with user tokens

Some operations in Nova could take a long time to complete. During this
time user token associated with this request could expire. When Nova tries
to communicate with other services using the same user token, Keystone fails
to validate the request due to expired token.

Service token will be passed along with user token to communicate with
services when dealing with long running tasks like live migration.
Keystone middlewere trusts that the service got the user token when
it was valid, don't check the expiry date of cert.

Change-Id: I48618a1f1438cde7b6d6ced0622fb2bdee45c1b2
Previously-approved: Ocata
"}]
commit_message:
Send service token along with user tokens

Some operations in Nova could take a long time to complete. During this
time user token associated with this request could expire. When Nova tries
to communicate with other services using the same user token, Keystone fails
to validate the request due to expired token.

Service token will be passed along with user token to communicate with
services when dealing with long running tasks like live migration.
Keystone middlewere trusts that the service got the user token when
it was valid, don't check the expiry date of cert.

Change-Id: I48618a1f1438cde7b6d6ced0622fb2bdee45c1b2
Previously-approved: Ocata

commit_message:
Add libpq-dev to install os_tempest plugins

We were getting errors locally [0] that complained about libpq-dev not
being installed. This was causing os_tempest plugins installations
to fail, snowballing the run.

This commit adds libpq-dev to the ubuntu 16.04 variables so that we
ensure it's installed before we get to that step.

[0] http://cdn.pasteraw.com/1sdkssty5uvgq315hj7g5lvwpm8xyob

Change-Id: I82eb012ac9d3a630e072e6b873419b86fa39333b

We need to run nova-cell_v2-discover_hosts at the very end of the
deployment because nova database needs to be aware of all registred

1. Move keystone resources management at step 3.
2. Move nova-compute service at step 4.
3. Move nova-placement-api at step 3.
5. Run nova-cell_v2-discover_hosts at step 5 on one nova-api node.

commit_message:
Run nova-cell_v2-discover_hosts at step 5

We need to run nova-cell_v2-discover_hosts at the very end of the
deployment because nova database needs to be aware of all registred
compute hosts.

1. Move keystone resources management at step 3.
2. Move nova-compute service at step 4.
3. Move nova-placement-api at step 3.
5. Run nova-cell_v2-discover_hosts at step 5 on one nova-api node.
6. Run neutron-ovs-agent at step 5 to avoid racy deployments where
   it starts before neutron-server when doing HA deployments.

With that change, we expect Nova aware of all compute services deployed
in TripleO during an initial deployment.

Depends-On: If943157b2b4afeb640919e77ef0214518e13ee15
Change-Id: I6f2df2a83a248fb5dc21c2bd56029eb45b66ceae
Related-Bug: #1663273
Related-Bug: #1663458

commit_message:
Make wait_until default as 'ACTIVE' in manager.create_server

All callings to manager.create_server pass wait_until='ACTIVE',
so this is to make wail_until default as 'ACTIVE', not None.

commit_message:
Add support booting baremetals from Cinder volume

This commit proposes changes to Nova Ironic virt driver to support
booting from Cinder volume (in tandem with other changes proposed
in Ironic).

Co-Authored-By: Satoru Moriya <satoru.moriya.br@hitachi.com>
Co-Authored-By: Debayan Ray <debayan.ray@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Hironori Shiina <shiina.hironori@jp.fujitsu.com>
Implements: blueprint ironic-boot-from-volume
Change-Id: Id027a987a0455853be50bde61aab0785be940f13

commit_message:
Fix backup create and restore scenario race problem

During running cinder's CreateAndRestoreVolumeBackup scenario
we have race problem with backup deleting, because here [0] we
are waiting not for backup 'available' status, but for volume's
and at the deleting moment backup is still in 'restoring' status.

This patch fixes this problem.

[0] - https://github.com/openstack/rally/blob/77cabd1769a3646b33703c0b91edd2b44a6dcf0a/rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/cinder/utils.py#L372-L378

Change-Id: I8ff9c349c5116211af7c47bb3fbeb7489144d26e
Closes-Bug: #1660965

commit_message:
Passing parsed_args to create_tempest_deployer_input

So far, create_tempest_deployer_input have some settings hard coded.
However, depending of the deployment options, some settings are required,
some don't.
This patch pass the parsed_args object to the method, and also set the
setting storage_protocol under volume section to ceph, if ceph is configured
to be deployed.
Other options can be added over time

Change-Id: I42173784e6d9c1378ed987066739db93bcfb9003

commit_message:
Allow None for block_device_mapping_v2.boot_index

The legacy v2 API allowed None for the boot_index [1]. It
allowed this implicitly because the API code would convert
the block_device_mapping_v2 dict from the request into a
BlockDeviceMapping object, which has a boot_index field that
is nullable (allows None).

The API reference documentation [2] also says:

"To disable a device from booting, set the boot index
to a negative value or use the default boot index value,
which is None."

It appears that with the move to v2.1 and request schema
validation, the boot_index schema was erroneously set to
not allow None for a value, which is not backward compatible
with the v2 API behavior.

This change fixes the schema to allow boot_index=None again
and adds a test to show it working.

This should not require a microversion bump since it's fixing
a regression in the v2.1 API which worked in the v2 API and
is already handled throughout Nova's block device code.

Closes-Bug: #1662699

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0/nova/compute/api.py#L1268
[2] http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#create-server

Change-Id: Ice78a0982bcce491f0c9690903ed2c6b6aaab1be
(cherry picked from commit e34f05edb2efc79bfdd8e73cca8fa02ea6ef2d60)
(cherry picked from commit ff1925ae47245f056690889a6e063ebce1bb7a80)
(cherry picked from commit dce8618166d80dc6cf2854920f6275eee73b8d84)

subject: Wait for nova-compute service registration
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-10 12:52:17.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/nova_compute_wait.yml', 'handlers/main.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Wait for nova-compute service registration

A race condition is caused when nova-compute is started for the
first time because it takes a period of time for nova-compute
to spin up, register itself with nova API, and become available for
cell enrollment.

Prior to this there was no wait condition when nova-compute
restarts occurred, so the first time nova-compute started, often
the compute service was not registered in the database and available
for cell enrollment when the enrollment tasks ran.

Change-Id: I510f0a957f53d15affa1fc23f809abff52208438
(cherry picked from commit b9b8e08ac00ef93fca2521ba378cc16df587dad5)
'}]
commit_message:
Wait for nova-compute service registration

A race condition is caused when nova-compute is started for the
first time because it takes a period of time for nova-compute
to spin up, register itself with nova API, and become available for
cell enrollment.

Prior to this there was no wait condition when nova-compute
restarts occurred, so the first time nova-compute started, often
the compute service was not registered in the database and available
for cell enrollment when the enrollment tasks ran.

Change-Id: I510f0a957f53d15affa1fc23f809abff52208438
(cherry picked from commit b9b8e08ac00ef93fca2521ba378cc16df587dad5)

commit_message:
Install openstackclient into virtualenv

There may be issues caused by updated OpenStack python libraries being
picked up by other services when we install python-openstackclient
globally. So instead install it into its own virtualenv and create a
symlink to the resulting binary.

Change-Id: I43d9baf13dda20d39d3c52faf1f2322eee4884a3
Partial-Bug: 1661708

commit_message:
Fix idempotence for nova cell1 create

nova-manage returns 0 if the cell is created, 1 if the cell creation
fails, and 2 if the cell already exists. So we can use the return
codes from nova-manage to avoid failure when the cell already exists,
and also to properly set ansible's ok/changed status.

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/1102441a4259fe155eb2a61cd16c6e015787472c/nova/cmd/manage.py#L1425

Change-Id: I078caf682aa01db6d5a1472946b25159f3473586
(cherry picked from commit d2da078745c8eb2e3f579d4bbdb50bbbe12eb0db)

Part of ironic-inspector devstack plugins cleanup proceedure is to try

commit_message:
Ensure devstack does not try to delete a physical NIC

Part of ironic-inspector devstack plugins cleanup proceedure is to try
to delete the ironic-inspector network interface if it isn't the ovs
bridge. This means that if you configure devstack to point at a real
network interface it'll try to delete it and fail breaking devstack.

Change-Id: I4f18edcf86278cce787a5f33f3d9f2444d738f2c

commit_message:
Trivial: remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I3e6e8152ef941ef884507caf50d1a80c0a8e83bd

commit_message:
Add an update_cell command to nova-manage

In case a cell record was incorrectly created, or needs to be updated
to point to a new database or mq endpoint, we need a way for users to
be able to update a CellMapping record. Since deleting and re-creating
is definitely not an option, this patch adds an update_cell which
allows updating the mutable fields if necessary.

(cherry picked from commit 1102441a4259fe155eb2a61cd16c6e015787472c)

Change-Id: I75ddfa458a6fb650f1098505193398984f2be596

subject: Allow None for block_device_mapping_v2.boot_index
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 15:20:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/block_device_mapping.py', 'nova/block_device.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_block_device_mapping.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1662699-06203e7262e02aa6.yaml'], 'message': 'Allow None for block_device_mapping_v2.boot_index

The legacy v2 API allowed None for the boot_index [1]. It
allowed this implicitly because the API code would convert
the block_device_mapping_v2 dict from the request into a
BlockDeviceMapping object, which has a boot_index field that
is nullable (allows None).

The API reference documentation [2] also says:

"To disable a device from booting, set the boot index
to a negative value or use the default boot index value,
which is None."

It appears that with the move to v2.1 and request schema
validation, the boot_index schema was erroneously set to
not allow None for a value, which is not backward compatible
with the v2 API behavior.

This change fixes the schema to allow boot_index=None again
and adds a test to show it working.

This should not require a microversion bump since it's fixing
a regression in the v2.1 API which worked in the v2 API and
is already handled throughout Nova's block device code.

Closes-Bug: #1662699

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0/nova/compute/api.py#L1268
[2] http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#create-server

Change-Id: Ice78a0982bcce491f0c9690903ed2c6b6aaab1be
(cherry picked from commit e34f05edb2efc79bfdd8e73cca8fa02ea6ef2d60)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow None for block_device_mapping_v2.boot_index

The legacy v2 API allowed None for the boot_index [1]. It
allowed this implicitly because the API code would convert
the block_device_mapping_v2 dict from the request into a
BlockDeviceMapping object, which has a boot_index field that
is nullable (allows None).

The API reference documentation [2] also says:

"To disable a device from booting, set the boot index
to a negative value or use the default boot index value,
which is None."

It appears that with the move to v2.1 and request schema
validation, the boot_index schema was erroneously set to
not allow None for a value, which is not backward compatible
with the v2 API behavior.

This change fixes the schema to allow boot_index=None again
and adds a test to show it working.

This should not require a microversion bump since it's fixing
a regression in the v2.1 API which worked in the v2 API and
is already handled throughout Nova's block device code.

Closes-Bug: #1662699

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/13.0.0/nova/compute/api.py#L1268
[2] http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#create-server

Change-Id: Ice78a0982bcce491f0c9690903ed2c6b6aaab1be
(cherry picked from commit e34f05edb2efc79bfdd8e73cca8fa02ea6ef2d60)

They will later be upgraded manually by the operator who will

We can also deliver any service specific upgrade configuration,

commit_message:
Delivers upgrade scripts where upgrade steps are disabled

This delivers a /root/tripleo_upgrade_node.sh to those nodes
that have the disable_upgrade_deployment flag set to true.
They will later be upgraded manually by the operator who will
invoke the script delivered here using upgrade-non-controller.sh

We can also deliver any service specific upgrade configuration,
such as configuring nova-compute to use the placement API as this
is required in order for placement to be configured and installed
during the subsequent upgrade steps for controller services.

This removes the compute and swift specific upgrade scripts as
they are now merged into the common
tripleo_upgrade_node.sh - removing any hard coded
reference to a particular role name (compute/objectstorage) and
only relying on the disable_upgrade_deployment is roles_data.yaml

Change-Id: I4531a4038b78087ef4a1a62c35f1328822427817
Co-Authored-By: Mathieu Bultel <mbultel@redhat.com>

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-28 09:27:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/floating_ip.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_floating_ip.py'], 'message': "Fix floating-ip-list to show associated instance info

floating-ip-list does not show information about associated instance.
Add expected_attrs=['fixed_ip'] in method get_by_project as _from_db_object
method expects it. If the expected_attrs=['fixed_ip'] is not passed to
_from_db_object, it will not get the fixed_ip info and hence the
floating-ip-list don't show the fixed_ip and server_id info.

Change-Id: I731f21d4b852a11141984b047112ed4739c32ecc
Closes-Bug: #1607350

commit_message:
Fix floating-ip-list to show associated instance info

floating-ip-list does not show information about associated instance.
Add expected_attrs=['fixed_ip'] in method get_by_project as _from_db_object
method expects it. If the expected_attrs=['fixed_ip'] is not passed to
_from_db_object, it will not get the fixed_ip info and hence the
floating-ip-list don't show the fixed_ip and server_id info.

Change-Id: I731f21d4b852a11141984b047112ed4739c32ecc

commit_message:
Remove 3DES from ssl_cipher_suite

Triple-DES is a vulnerable cipher and should be disabled by default.

https://sweet32.info/
https://www.openssl.org/blog/blog/2016/08/24/sweet32/

Change-Id: I3171abf6c630f287653e7d80f4ba3ff1cc8db375

subject: Ensures the host IP isn't used for containers
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-10 09:44:31.000000000', 'files': ['etc/openstack_deploy/openstack_user_config.yml.aio'], 'message': "Ensures the host IP isn't used for containers

We statically configure the host IP for many networks during the
bootstrap AIO process. Later, when the inventory is generated,
we use an IP from the queue, which could be conflicting with the
host (Probability: 1 on 204).

This should fix it.

Change-Id: I5a49eebef48892d7266684f1ffdbe1d08d82c211
"}]
commit_message:
Ensures the host IP isn't used for containers

We statically configure the host IP for many networks during the
bootstrap AIO process. Later, when the inventory is generated,
we use an IP from the queue, which could be conflicting with the
host (Probability: 1 on 204).

This should fix it.

Change-Id: I5a49eebef48892d7266684f1ffdbe1d08d82c211

When exception occurs in _live_migration, _rollback_live_migration
is called to rollback the destination resources else next live
migration will fail.

Change-Id: Iac9388759deabbe914d8051fc5a9e1dcb58ad51c
closes-bug: #1415001

commit_message:
Live migration rollback on failure

When exception occurs in _live_migration, _rollback_live_migration
is called to rollback the destination resources else next live
migration will fail.

Change-Id: Iac9388759deabbe914d8051fc5a9e1dcb58ad51c
closes-bug: #1415001

This patch fixes the documentation title, the name of the project is
VirtualBMC (with the capital cases) and also fix the README, it changes
the order of "team and repository tag" title to be the last and add
graceful shutdown and NMI as supported commands for ipmitool.

Change-Id: Ieb857b4c1065d5fff2028ee78a4a4e8586cd4724

commit_message:
Fix documentation title and README

This patch fixes the documentation title, the name of the project is
VirtualBMC (with the capital cases) and also fix the README, it changes
the order of "team and repository tag" title to be the last and add
graceful shutdown and NMI as supported commands for ipmitool.

Change-Id: Ieb857b4c1065d5fff2028ee78a4a4e8586cd4724

subject: Prepare for using standard python tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-04 08:51:13.000000000', 'files': ['HACKING.rst', 'tools/test-setup.sh'], 'message': 'Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Update HACKING for this.

Needed-By: I98c1b799e520cad102b9e47cf51477f54b07e732
Change-Id: Id5e3b67190866acdebee2b89f4393d5c407a5b96
(cherry picked from commit 6e5593f11baa7423ac421126bb0c082d1e034cdc)
'}]
commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Update HACKING for this.

Needed-By: I98c1b799e520cad102b9e47cf51477f54b07e732
Change-Id: Id5e3b67190866acdebee2b89f4393d5c407a5b96
(cherry picked from commit 6e5593f11baa7423ac421126bb0c082d1e034cdc)

commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Update HACKING for this.

subject: nova: start compute after keystone endpoints/services
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-10 03:11:03.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp'], 'message': "nova: start compute after keystone endpoints/services

Nova team suggest it to avoid situations where nova-compute don't find
the placement service in the service catalog, which could lead to
compute resource not registred.

Change-Id: I9692ddbeb0d06889c1a18a7203ab9d0409bfa04b
Closes-Bug: #1663273
"}]
commit_message:
nova: start compute after keystone endpoints/services

Nova team suggest it to avoid situations where nova-compute don't find
the placement service in the service catalog, which could lead to
compute resource not registred.

Change-Id: I9692ddbeb0d06889c1a18a7203ab9d0409bfa04b
Closes-Bug: #1663273

commit_message:
devstack: Remove extra setting from sample configs

With the recent version of networking-l2gw [1][2], these cause
the ini file specified twice and end up with "non unique
providers" error.

[1] Idf39758147e8f3ea8fe9beb4f580fff391bf8380
[2] I2d4d103b7c0912082dc5f8d984f3800d77d2a690

Related-Bug: #1600664

subject: Use ocata component for UCA
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-10 09:42:51.000000000', 'files': ['vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml'], 'message': 'Use ocata component for UCA

ocata component for UCA is now published, we should use it instead
of staying on newton.

The group the package installs has changed from libvirtd to libvirt.
This patch changes the variable used to the appropriate group.

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/430222
- https://review.openstack.org/431087

Change-Id: Idb6b9ac1c9b557322cd534fe48598c9d264e56d7
(cherry picked from commit d81b7e681d055814885a6d3eeac68fa729e19b45)
'}]
commit_message:
Use ocata component for UCA

ocata component for UCA is now published, we should use it instead
of staying on newton.

The group the package installs has changed from libvirtd to libvirt.
This patch changes the variable used to the appropriate group.

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/430222
- https://review.openstack.org/431087

Change-Id: Idb6b9ac1c9b557322cd534fe48598c9d264e56d7
(cherry picked from commit d81b7e681d055814885a6d3eeac68fa729e19b45)

commit_message:
DVR: delete stale devices after router update

After the external network change of router gateway, the l3 agent
deletes stale external devices in the qrouter namespace only. This
doesn't apply to distributed router.

This patch extract a method named _delete_stale_external_devices from
RouterInfo and override it in DvrEdgeRouter.

Conflicts:
        neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_router.py
        neutron/agent/l3/router_info.py
        neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py

Change-Id: I2602efd5be92ec57410e54cf9c26641330a52ee6
Fixes-Bug: #1651813
(cherry picked from commit dcd4c8b8de4972b8e5aff55e041df54f66ac81b3)

subject: Fix root password set for percona repo package
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 00:15:35.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/percona_utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix root password set for percona repo package

When the percona-cluster repository is used the name of the package
is percona-xtradb-cluster-server not percona-server-server.
Add percona-xtradb-cluster-server to the debconf set selections so
the root password can be set.

Change-Id: Ic15e03aaa7bab1db27ca1294584e51c4014fcd96
Closes-Bug: #1662642
'}]
commit_message:
Fix root password set for percona repo package

When the percona-cluster repository is used the name of the package
is percona-xtradb-cluster-server not percona-server-server.
Add percona-xtradb-cluster-server to the debconf set selections so
the root password can be set.

Change-Id: Ic15e03aaa7bab1db27ca1294584e51c4014fcd96
Closes-Bug: #1662642

commit_message:
delete resourses created by clientManager

When execute tempest test, two projects and two users was
created in env. This patch uses addCleanup to clean
resource.

A recent patch introduced lines starting with "# ex:-" to config/localrc.
This can result in the vim editor taking everyting after the colon as a

Change-Id: I3b4622105922cee8b4866321bb9d32a249dd9877
'}]
commit_message:
Remove vim modeline

A recent patch introduced lines starting with "# ex:-" to config/localrc.
This can result in the vim editor taking everyting after the colon as a
modeline which produces an error.

This patch changes these lines to avoid the confusion.

Change-Id: I3b4622105922cee8b4866321bb9d32a249dd9877

the relation id and unit name parameters are used so that
MDS keys with a name of 'None' are not created.

commit_message:
mds: ensure relation_get is scoped for mds-name

mds_relation_joined can be called outside of the scope
of the mds-relation-changed hook execution; ensure that
the relation id and unit name parameters are used so that
MDS keys with a name of 'None' are not created.

Change-Id: Ied8d5306ab77b8e68efd0a8e5df4087a067f0367

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-12 12:23:34.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/lib/wbatch/template-find_vbm_bat'], 'message': 'Windows batch scripts: Search for VBoxManage on drive D:

Some Windows machines come with an operating system disk (often a small
SSD) and a data disk where most of the applications reside.

In order to find VBoxManage on such Windows systems, this patch searches
the D: drive as well before giving up.

Change-Id: I95140143e0a18cbce4179dcf8b57d16a9d0c986b
'}]
commit_message:
Windows batch scripts: Search for VBoxManage on drive D:

Some Windows machines come with an operating system disk (often a small
SSD) and a data disk where most of the applications reside.

In order to find VBoxManage on such Windows systems, this patch searches
the D: drive as well before giving up.

Change-Id: I95140143e0a18cbce4179dcf8b57d16a9d0c986b

commit_message:
Collect and manage logs when validating HA

This commit manages all the stdout and stderr status of each HA
validation test.
In this way it will be possible to have all the logs related to the
tests in one place (on the undercloud) that will be collected by the
collect_logs role and so accessible from the external location where
the logs will be stored.

Change-Id: Ie803a920a17bd2f24ccd89f733781dd7e4d07fdd

commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Update devref for this.

Needed-By: Iea42a0525b2c5a5cdbf8604eb23a6e7b029f6b48
Change-Id: Ie9bae659077dbe299eea131572117036065bdccf
(cherry picked from commit d60dffc6bef4d2de32b9509a62f894136c434c3c)

Change-Id: Iae9a12952cd3fe285eed3d8fca2e667a68de15c7

commit_message:
This feature is supporting for workers config in swift servers.

Currently it doesn't work in swift servers such as proxy-server,
object-server, account-server and container-server, in spite of
setting openstack_service_workers config in globals.yml.

Because it's not implement about workers in swift.

Closes-Bug: #1662751

Change-Id: Iae9a12952cd3fe285eed3d8fca2e667a68de15c7
Signed-off-by: jangseon ryu <jangseon.ryu@navercorp.com>

commit_message:
Explicitly configure credentials used by ironic to access swift

Using keystone_authtoken credentials for this purpose is deprecated.

Also add missing manifest includes (all but swift one are also implicitly
included due to backward compatibility).

commit_message:
Remove 'verbose' option (again)

The deprecation for this was merged on aug 1, 2015 in review:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/206437/
That was a long time ago so it should be possible to remove it now.

This was already merged once but had to be reverted because some
projects were still relying on it. Let's try again, this time using
INFO default not WARNING, thanks dtantsur!

Change-Id: Iac62cb252db0e8d86c352210089d70405edb5c4d

commit_message:
Provide default haproxy_ssl_cipher_suite

Provide a default 'haproxy_ssl_cipher_suite' var for when this role is
run outside of an integrated OpenStack-Ansible deployment.

commit_message:
Switch to use test_utils.call_until_true

test.call_until_true has been deprecated since Newton on Tempest side,
and now Tempest provides test_utils.call_until_true as the stable
library method. So this patch switches to use the stable method before
removing old test.call_until_true on Tempest side.

Change-Id: If8985f511d434af0449992b2bc3540da9b3a0591

subject: Use "Default", "Value" and "DefaultValue" for Heat parameters
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-09 11:01:19.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/stacks/forms.py'], 'message': 'Use "Default", "Value" and "DefaultValue" for Heat parameters

It seems there has been changes in the Heat API, and it no longer
returns the default value for a parameter in the "Default" key, it
has been instead renamed to "DefaultValue" and later to "Value".
This patch makes it use all those key names, whichever exists.

Change-Id: Ia86d8d79fcd48974ffe3fecf21a7153bf2ba6a9a
'}]
commit_message:
Use "Default", "Value" and "DefaultValue" for Heat parameters

It seems there has been changes in the Heat API, and it no longer
returns the default value for a parameter in the "Default" key, it
has been instead renamed to "DefaultValue" and later to "Value".
This patch makes it use all those key names, whichever exists.

Change-Id: Ia86d8d79fcd48974ffe3fecf21a7153bf2ba6a9a

subject: Use more specific asserts and fix an assertion in tests
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-02-10 03:58:34.000000000', 'files': ['manilaclient/tests/unit/test_api_versions.py', 'manilaclient/tests/functional/test_shares_listing.py', 'manilaclient/tests/functional/test_shares.py'], 'message': "Use more specific asserts and fix an assertion in tests

Instead of assertTrue and assertFalse use more specific asserts.
They are compatible with Python 2.7[1] and 3.4[2]

Also remove test for export locations in the share API because:
* export locations were removed from the GET /shares/{id}
  API in version 2.9.
* The point of the test doesn't seem to be to validate *all*
  fields in the  API response.

[1]: https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html
[2]: https://docs.python.org/3.4/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: Ie5e23c544ed7415518a0e6551f5ffdbc2ee5a3e2
"}]
commit_message:
Use more specific asserts and fix an assertion in tests

Instead of assertTrue and assertFalse use more specific asserts.
They are compatible with Python 2.7[1] and 3.4[2]

Also remove test for export locations in the share API because:
* export locations were removed from the GET /shares/{id}
  API in version 2.9.
* The point of the test doesn't seem to be to validate *all*
  fields in the  API response.

[1]: https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html
[2]: https://docs.python.org/3.4/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: Ie5e23c544ed7415518a0e6551f5ffdbc2ee5a3e2

subject: Enable multiple RDs of a BGPVPN to be passed to OpenDaylight
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 15:35:18.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/service_drivers/opendaylight/odl.py'], 'message': 'Enable multiple RDs of a BGPVPN to be passed to OpenDaylight

Earlier, only one RD from the list of RDs for a BGPVPN was
passed to OpenDaylight since OpenDaylight Controller had
a limitation that it can process BGPVPNs with only a single RD.
From Carbon release cycle, OpenDaylight is being enhanced to
support BGPVPNs that host multiple RDs.

Change-Id: If9fbf447e1048d52ca749ca6757b45b729223e76
Closes-Bug: #1662930
'}]
commit_message:
Enable multiple RDs of a BGPVPN to be passed to OpenDaylight

Earlier, only one RD from the list of RDs for a BGPVPN was
passed to OpenDaylight since OpenDaylight Controller had
a limitation that it can process BGPVPNs with only a single RD.
From Carbon release cycle, OpenDaylight is being enhanced to
support BGPVPNs that host multiple RDs.

Change-Id: If9fbf447e1048d52ca749ca6757b45b729223e76
Closes-Bug: #1662930

subject: Advertise support for python 3 and drop py34 jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-08 08:49:32.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Advertise support for python 3 and drop py34 jobs

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

This patch add support python 3 to classifier and drop py34 environment
from tox

Change-Id: I69c1c724990aadb7aecabd264382ffd661eb632a
'}]
commit_message:
Advertise support for python 3 and drop py34 jobs

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

This patch add support python 3 to classifier and drop py34 environment
from tox

Change-Id: I69c1c724990aadb7aecabd264382ffd661eb632a

subject: Make flavor updating compatible with nova cli
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-22 07:48:35.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/flavors/workflows.py'], 'message': 'Make flavor updating compatible with nova cli

1. When modifying access in horizon, the flavor should not be deleted
   and the uuid changed. This is to match the behavior of performing
   theses tasks via the cli.
2. When no changes are made after hitting Edit Flavor and then save.
   The flavor should also not be deleted and recreated with new uuid.

Change-Id: I4387cd2106eb135d2050b9456312150644fa4e00
Closes-Bug: 1616223
(cherry picked from commit b2e99dbeaf9a7f59f1251219719177875ca5e265)
'}]
commit_message:
Make flavor updating compatible with nova cli

1. When modifying access in horizon, the flavor should not be deleted
   and the uuid changed. This is to match the behavior of performing
   theses tasks via the cli.
2. When no changes are made after hitting Edit Flavor and then save.
   The flavor should also not be deleted and recreated with new uuid.

Change-Id: I4387cd2106eb135d2050b9456312150644fa4e00
Closes-Bug: 1616223
(cherry picked from commit b2e99dbeaf9a7f59f1251219719177875ca5e265)

commit_message:
Fix settings for Newton release

- The keystone_default_domain must be the ID of the domain and not its
  name.
- The comment for the CACHES setting was updated upstream.
- The FLAVOR_EXTRA_KEYS setting got deprecated, so we drop it.

Change-Id: I8930e36883b64fa823438289e26602ea243f7fe6

subject: Support for restart of services from subordianates
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-08 10:50:47.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_nova_compute_hooks.py', 'hooks/nova_compute_hooks.py'], 'message': "Support for restart of services from subordianates

Neutron subordinate charms that manage underlying PCI devices, such
as SR-IOV VF's, need to ensure that the nova-compute service is
restarted after the underlying device configuration has been
completed, so that the nova pci_devices database is correctly
populated as part of the nova-compute startup process.

Add a service_restart_handler to the neutron-plugin-relation-changed
hook to allow subordinate charms to request restarts using the
standard restart-nonce trigger mechanism.

Change-Id: I2a4fcaa0988dae0b85904ff84ff5e492d651a043
"}]
commit_message:
Support for restart of services from subordianates

Neutron subordinate charms that manage underlying PCI devices, such
as SR-IOV VF's, need to ensure that the nova-compute service is
restarted after the underlying device configuration has been
completed, so that the nova pci_devices database is correctly
populated as part of the nova-compute startup process.

Add a service_restart_handler to the neutron-plugin-relation-changed
hook to allow subordinate charms to request restarts using the
standard restart-nonce trigger mechanism.

Change-Id: I2a4fcaa0988dae0b85904ff84ff5e492d651a043

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-31 01:12:28.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml', 'templates/cinder.conf.j2'], 'message': "Add variable to enable integration with barbican

Add a new variable, 'cinder_barbican_enabled', that will handle setting
the configuration options required to make use of barbican.

Change-Id: If9aaa19bff5be25c46df067387ef83ce81d14ca1
"}]
commit_message:
Add variable to enable integration with barbican

Add a new variable, 'cinder_barbican_enabled', that will handle setting
the configuration options required to make use of barbican.

Change-Id: If9aaa19bff5be25c46df067387ef83ce81d14ca1

subject: Add group vars to enable integration with barbican
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-07 21:21:55.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/group_vars/cinder_all.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/all.yml'], 'message': "Add group vars to enable integration with barbican

Add group variables, 'nova_barbican_enabled' and
'cinder_barbican_enabled', that will be set dependent on the
availability of barbican hosts within an environment and enable
integration of barbican with nova and cinder.

Change-Id: I52dd6dc5f83d2e1288f565c03c0337cf0ae00ace
Depends-On: If9aaa19bff5be25c46df067387ef83ce81d14ca1
Depends-On: I61eddc831825a9274ff26caf62da44798336e99d
"}]
commit_message:
Add group vars to enable integration with barbican

Add group variables, 'nova_barbican_enabled' and
'cinder_barbican_enabled', that will be set dependent on the
availability of barbican hosts within an environment and enable
integration of barbican with nova and cinder.

Change-Id: I52dd6dc5f83d2e1288f565c03c0337cf0ae00ace
Depends-On: If9aaa19bff5be25c46df067387ef83ce81d14ca1
Depends-On: I61eddc831825a9274ff26caf62da44798336e99d

subject: Remove 3DES from trove_ssl_cipher_suite
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-10 01:45:42.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Remove 3DES from trove_ssl_cipher_suite

Triple-DES is a vulnerable cipher and should be disabled by default.

https://sweet32.info/
https://www.openssl.org/blog/blog/2016/08/24/sweet32/

Change-Id: Id2d22e4dafb6bf34add554a5346ead5a9552e828
'}]
commit_message:
Remove 3DES from trove_ssl_cipher_suite

Triple-DES is a vulnerable cipher and should be disabled by default.

https://sweet32.info/
https://www.openssl.org/blog/blog/2016/08/24/sweet32/

Change-Id: Id2d22e4dafb6bf34add554a5346ead5a9552e828

https://sweet32.info/

commit_message:
Remove 3DES from gnocchi_ssl_cipher_suite

Triple-DES is a vulnerable cipher and should be disabled by default.

https://sweet32.info/
https://www.openssl.org/blog/blog/2016/08/24/sweet32/

Change-Id: Ic274ddce28dfa93619d30b35d8a1f9504fc18996

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-09 14:51:46.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/upgrade/settings', 'devstack/upgrade/resources.sh'], 'message': '[Grenade] Switch base to stable/ocata

We should test two neighbour branches in grenade job.
So, after branching of stable/ocata we should use it as base
for testing of manila migration to current master branch (Pike-dev).

Also, update existing code to be consistent with newer microversion.

Change-Id: Id78c30e2000186958a2eb8f6fd727042d9b31862
'}]
commit_message:
[Grenade] Switch base to stable/ocata

We should test two neighbour branches in grenade job.
So, after branching of stable/ocata we should use it as base
for testing of manila migration to current master branch (Pike-dev).

Also, update existing code to be consistent with newer microversion.

Change-Id: Id78c30e2000186958a2eb8f6fd727042d9b31862

commit_message:
Change the group name for the libvirt group

The group the package installs has changed from libvirtd to libvirt.
This patch changes the variable used to the appropriate group.

Change-Id: I22a1a9f2398b266dec780195329e1ea43868ed36
(cherry picked from commit 46c1576c1ee36a97b069a92efa72dc49c650a634)

all instances of the install_command override relating to testing which

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101474.html

subject: [k8s] Get logs of controller-manager and scheduler
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-30 14:13:00.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/contrib/copy_instance_logs.sh'], 'message': '[k8s] Get logs of controller-manager and scheduler

Get the pod logs for controller-manager and scheduler.

The current copy logs from journalctl because controller-manager
and scheduler used to be managed by systemd.

Change-Id: I1e4e5a810f838cc59d4a4aaa4fc4478541872b0b
'}]
commit_message:
[k8s] Get logs of controller-manager and scheduler

Get the pod logs for controller-manager and scheduler.

The current copy logs from journalctl because controller-manager
and scheduler used to be managed by systemd.

Change-Id: I1e4e5a810f838cc59d4a4aaa4fc4478541872b0b

subject: Fix UC Charter syntax
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 09:02:09.000000000', 'files': ['reference/charter.rst'], 'message': 'Fix UC Charter syntax

The bulleted list under AUC was not correctly marked up for RST.

This change fixes that, adds human-readable names for the links and
removes one point that was duplicated

Change-Id: I9e721808d4fbc6a1834f24f2a5cfab9ae1e048e5
'}]
commit_message:
Fix UC Charter syntax

The bulleted list under AUC was not correctly marked up for RST.

This change fixes that, adds human-readable names for the links and
removes one point that was duplicated

Change-Id: I9e721808d4fbc6a1834f24f2a5cfab9ae1e048e5

commit_message:
Remove heat-params sourcing

Since commit 220675d42a578e51b401c72c7940b5664a289406 heat-params are
used by systemd and are unnecessary.

Implements: blueprint coreos-best-pratice
Change-Id: Iaf88219db2d3aaa452ff07a146acb3fbef323eb1

commit_message:
Support the command "zun top"

The BP adds "zun top" which can display progress in container.

Change-Id: I2f25349eb49d6f29724a0acfdf42c36bf1649b6c
Implements: blueprint support-zun-top

subject: Rename placement job to nova-next
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 18:32:46.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/nova.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Rename placement job to nova-next

This job is really more than just testing nova with
the placement service (which was new in newton), since
it's also running with cells v2 (also optionial in newton).

The intent of this job is to test the latest features in nova
which for Pike would be things like cinder v3 and
sending service user tokens with regular user tokens (both of
which are available in pike).

We can control the features enabled in the builder based on
the branch the job is running against.

As of this patch, this job is still only running in stable/newton.
Once we start adding some more features for testing in Pike, we
can make this run in master (Pike) also.

Change-Id: Idc3a3c82eaaedb9bd75f9bb4774469853d453899
"}]
commit_message:
Rename placement job to nova-next

This job is really more than just testing nova with
the placement service (which was new in newton), since
it's also running with cells v2 (also optionial in newton).

The intent of this job is to test the latest features in nova
which for Pike would be things like cinder v3 and
sending service user tokens with regular user tokens (both of
which are available in pike).

We can control the features enabled in the builder based on
the branch the job is running against.

As of this patch, this job is still only running in stable/newton.
Once we start adding some more features for testing in Pike, we
can make this run in master (Pike) also.

Change-Id: Idc3a3c82eaaedb9bd75f9bb4774469853d453899

subject: Add doc root markers to infra publications
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-10 01:31:54.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/infra-publications.yaml'], 'message': "Add doc root markers to infra publications

These infra publications don't get root markers in their top level dirs,
the marker goes into the dir above them which results in the
publications getting removed. Reorder some things in the job so that the
marker is dropped first then copied where it needs to go thus preserving
these publications.

Change-Id: I947137f99b7fd552e46bdcecc7ce46fcffcc59a5
"}]
commit_message:
Add doc root markers to infra publications

These infra publications don't get root markers in their top level dirs,
the marker goes into the dir above them which results in the
publications getting removed. Reorder some things in the job so that the
marker is dropped first then copied where it needs to go thus preserving
these publications.

Change-Id: I947137f99b7fd552e46bdcecc7ce46fcffcc59a5

commit_message:
Remove docker-setup receipe

The docker-setup receive has been unmaintained and untested for some
time now. The nova-docker project is also being removed from
OpenStack [1] and people are advised to look at deploying Zun as
a replacement.

This also avoids having to rewrite this receipe in order to remove the
use of the deprecated python cookbook.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/430232

Change-Id: Ia8c9db272c6a0353130fc93d446b385fd72ac250
Partial-Bug: 1558538

commit_message:
Fetch unread notifications number

Replace 20sec polling of the whole notification collection
by polling of notification statistics (GET /api/notifications/stats)
which includes number of unread notifications.
This number is rendered in notifications badge in Fuel UI.

Also, notifications are marked as read by a new handler
PUT /api/notifications/change_status with {status: 'read'} payload.

Partial-Bug: #1657348

Depends-On: I2e6a0daaf8712ab3064df728a8fb463ef805aa06

Change-Id: I6a7eae7abf2b43143039db7ca262ae40ce5a30b4

Remove skip of test_stamp_pattern

test_stamp_pattern is skipped of bug 1205344 which is reported
at 2013, though there is no exact hint on whether the bug is

should have been fixed.

This is to remove the skip, and to fix several obvious errors
in the code.

subject: Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-25 02:29:48.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used
to keep codes from oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator.
Removing openstack/commonfrom all OpenStack code in favor of the
Oslo libraries is a project wide goal for the Ocata release. So
don't use this directory any more. We should drop it for improving
searching efficiency.

Change-Id: I9f43c58966e1ccc3b1057868cecb76495df9ac98
"}]
commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used
to keep codes from oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator.
Removing openstack/commonfrom all OpenStack code in favor of the
Oslo libraries is a project wide goal for the Ocata release. So
don't use this directory any more. We should drop it for improving
searching efficiency.

Change-Id: I9f43c58966e1ccc3b1057868cecb76495df9ac98

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-24 01:23:16.000000000', 'files': ['shotgun/driver.py'], 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne_

Change-Id: I2ad46683976ad8a3d7328dc02821598dbf50f2f9
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne_

Change-Id: I2ad46683976ad8a3d7328dc02821598dbf50f2f9

commit_message:
Hide property replacement policy for neutron port

Replacement policy was workaround for neutron port resource.
It has been deprecated in mitaka. Now it's time to hide this
property in case of pointlessness.

Change-Id: I2c1b214ac92fe21080804f3a1d3bd28f7f93a6a5

subject: Skip all dsvm jobs for diskimage-builder docs changes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-10 00:20:38.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Skip all dsvm jobs for diskimage-builder docs changes

I notcied we still run the gate-dsvm-nodepool-* tests when checking a
doc-only change.  This kind of defeats the purpose of keeping this
case short.  Skip all dsvm based jobs for diskimage-builder doc-only
changes.

Change-Id: I342dc6a52cdd54e526b282b1c06ee2cf13771f45
'}]
commit_message:
Skip all dsvm jobs for diskimage-builder docs changes

I notcied we still run the gate-dsvm-nodepool-* tests when checking a
doc-only change.  This kind of defeats the purpose of keeping this
case short.  Skip all dsvm based jobs for diskimage-builder doc-only
changes.

Change-Id: I342dc6a52cdd54e526b282b1c06ee2cf13771f45

subject: WIP:Create and configure vhostuser-socket-dir to be owned by qemu
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-04 06:13:37.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/vswitch_dpdk_spec.rb', 'manifests/dpdk.pp'], 'message': 'WIP:Create and configure vhostuser-socket-dir to be owned by qemu

1. create a directory for vhostuser sockets with owner->root,
   group->qemu, permissions->2775
2. Shall notify the ovs db with the vhostuser-socket-dir
   ovs-vsctl set Open_vSwitch . other_config:vhost-sock-dir=$vhostdir
   ovs-vsctl set Open_vSwitch . other_config:vhost-sock-perms=0775
   ovs-vsctl set Open_vSwitch . other_config:vhost-sock-owner=qemu

   The vhostuser-socket-dir referred here needs to be same value as
   neutron::agents::ml2::ovs::vhostuser_socket_dir

Change-Id: If7416a52ae08c965850562eb86061847a9b22486
Implements: blueprint tripleo-ovs-dpdk
Signed-off-by: karthik s <ksundara@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
WIP:Create and configure vhostuser-socket-dir to be owned by qemu

1. create a directory for vhostuser sockets with owner->root,
   group->qemu, permissions->2775
2. Shall notify the ovs db with the vhostuser-socket-dir
   ovs-vsctl set Open_vSwitch . other_config:vhost-sock-dir=$vhostdir
   ovs-vsctl set Open_vSwitch . other_config:vhost-sock-perms=0775
   ovs-vsctl set Open_vSwitch . other_config:vhost-sock-owner=qemu

   The vhostuser-socket-dir referred here needs to be same value as
   neutron::agents::ml2::ovs::vhostuser_socket_dir

Change-Id: If7416a52ae08c965850562eb86061847a9b22486
Implements: blueprint tripleo-ovs-dpdk
Signed-off-by: karthik s <ksundara@redhat.com>

subject: Benchmark requests during upgrade testing
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-02-09 18:36:45.000000000', 'files': ['tests/inventory', 'tests/test-install-previous-keystone.yml', 'tests/test-benchmark-keystone-upgrade.yml', 'tests/os_keystone-overrides.yml', 'tests/templates/locustfile.py', 'tests/test-upgrade.yml', 'tests/templates/auth.json', 'tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml', 'tasks/keystone_install.yml', 'tests/test-install-haproxy.yml', 'tests/keystone-test-vars.yml', 'tox.ini', 'tests/test-benchmark-keystone-upgrade-results.yml'], 'message': "Benchmark requests during upgrade testing

During upgrade testing, move Keystone containers behind an HAProxy
load balancer and run a benchmarking tool to make continuous requests
against the keystone API, providing summary output at the end of the
play. This should help ensure the upgrade process between releases
remains without downtime.

To avoid service interruptions because of files being replaced during
installations:
  - set the 'keystone_venv_tag' var so that it changes between releases
  - perform the 'Create WSGI symlinks' task only after the files being
    linked to exist

Benchmarking scripts were provided by:
https://github.com/lbragstad/keystone-performance-upgrade

Co-Authored-By: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I462e6496f125c7e263bbab188e86c45e1f4f7f1e
"}]
commit_message:
Benchmark requests during upgrade testing

During upgrade testing, move Keystone containers behind an HAProxy
load balancer and run a benchmarking tool to make continuous requests
against the keystone API, providing summary output at the end of the
play. This should help ensure the upgrade process between releases
remains without downtime.

To avoid service interruptions because of files being replaced during
installations:
  - set the 'keystone_venv_tag' var so that it changes between releases
  - perform the 'Create WSGI symlinks' task only after the files being
    linked to exist

Benchmarking scripts were provided by:
https://github.com/lbragstad/keystone-performance-upgrade

Co-Authored-By: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I462e6496f125c7e263bbab188e86c45e1f4f7f1e

commit_message:
Update oslo.context to 2.12

oslo.context 2.12 contains support for service token information that we
are going to start needing for inter-service communication. Bump the
minimum version so we can rely on this information.

commit_message:
Add osc-lib to requirements.txt

Without this requirement the installation of
python-magnumclient in an environment where nothing requires
osc-lib will at the very least break the command line
OpenStack client.

Change-Id: I905e2864a185e3135f45b23d9c3b87143e890e15
Closes-Bug: #1661035

commit_message:
Add the OSC 'cluster template list' command

There is OSC command support for 'cluster-template-list' but
it was not exposed. So this patch adds the command to setup.cfg.
Also fix the wrong class name used in the file.

Change-Id: Ia3a632ce2cf2b9cca646351902315b03fd0adb69

commit_message:
Remove unsupported HPE XP driver

CI. CI issues have not been resolved, so this now removes the driver.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-07 02:20:48.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_local_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_local_router.py'], 'message': 'DVR: Add static routes to FIP namespace

The static routes are currently only added to the router
namespace and snat namespace, but not added to the fip
namespace.

This patch adds the static routes configured for the router
to the FIP namespace, to its own table. So this will allow
the FIP namespace to be configured with different nexthop
routes for different routers.

Change-Id: Ida165d1ecf5c07af31dac11d9daed33ccaaf5605
Closes-Bug: #1571676
(cherry picked from commit c6de850021d099d6bad026b2192ea40b9c849f87)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Add static routes to FIP namespace

The static routes are currently only added to the router
namespace and snat namespace, but not added to the fip
namespace.

This patch adds the static routes configured for the router
to the FIP namespace, to its own table. So this will allow
the FIP namespace to be configured with different nexthop
routes for different routers.

Change-Id: Ida165d1ecf5c07af31dac11d9daed33ccaaf5605
Closes-Bug: #1571676
(cherry picked from commit c6de850021d099d6bad026b2192ea40b9c849f87)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 6593, 'name': 'Dirk Mueller', 'email': 'dirk@dmllr.de', 'username': 'dmllr'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 13404, 'name': 'Alberto Planas', 'email': 'aplanas@gmail.com', 'username': 'aplanas'}, {'_account_id': 14288, 'name': 'Matthew Thode', 'display_name': 'prometheanfire', 'email': 'mthode@mthode.org', 'username': 'prometheanfire'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-25 04:00:33.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Update sphinx requirement

In change I38580a5f765c7bb586dcf2786e91be15a8eba235 we skipped one of the
docutils versions due to a breaking release that was not supported by
sphinx. This has now been fixed in the latter[0].

With Sphinx 1.5.1, the blocking of docutils 0.13.1 is not needed
anymore, so remove the condition. This line could be removed completely,
but for that it first needs to be removed from all projects.

[0] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/3212

Change-Id: I01b7b6f3fac75e284debe211129b7b1e87c756d9
'}]
commit_message:
Update sphinx requirement

In change I38580a5f765c7bb586dcf2786e91be15a8eba235 we skipped one of the
docutils versions due to a breaking release that was not supported by
sphinx. This has now been fixed in the latter[0].

With Sphinx 1.5.1, the blocking of docutils 0.13.1 is not needed
anymore, so remove the condition. This line could be removed completely,
but for that it first needs to be removed from all projects.

[0] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/3212

Change-Id: I01b7b6f3fac75e284debe211129b7b1e87c756d9

commit_message:
heat stack-update assumes interfaces have fixed ip addresses

In stack-update for network object with no fixed ip address:
    Resource UPDATE failed: IndexError: resources.A_Server:
    list index out of range

Change-Id: I47bc35f0391af21d64918e82a73db3afa43c2608
Closes-Bug: #1660809

subject: Using yaml.safe_load instead of yaml.load
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-07 03:09:38.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-playbooks.sh', 'tests/test_inventory.py'], 'message': "Using yaml.safe_load instead of yaml.load

It is not safe to call yaml.load with any data received from
an untrusted source, we'd better use yaml.safe_load

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Ie921dc046b09493029b2724c39f1f717b37992e4
"}]
commit_message:
Using yaml.safe_load instead of yaml.load

It is not safe to call yaml.load with any data received from
an untrusted source, we'd better use yaml.safe_load

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Ie921dc046b09493029b2724c39f1f717b37992e4

commit_message:
Fix galera packages installation failure

Adding galera repo keys to avoid the error "E: There are
problems and -y was used without --force-yes" during galera
packages installation. This code is taken from master branch
to mitaka in this patch.

Change-Id: I2a6b04547d73e6c32cc9ac364f13a7ad3cd42e90
Closes-Bug: #1638993

commit_message:
Fix coverage option and execution

--coverage-package-name option was no longer supported by 'testr'[1].
This commit replaces from 'testr' to 'test' as coverage option.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/217847/

Change-Id: I0a085c4bf06d6015208c167a86c1dc58f6dfc126
Closes-Bug: #1628719

subject: Turn on bandit check as part of pep8
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 22:03:31.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Turn on bandit check as part of pep8

Add bandit job as part of pep8 in tox.ini

Had to ignore assert check since those are use for performance in the
validation code. Also, skipped bandit checks of monasca_common/kafka_lib
since that is just a clone of kafka-python and will be deleted in the
future

Change-Id: Ie2e726a8e45ef463c4e863792eed663ee472ed07
'}]
commit_message:
Turn on bandit check as part of pep8

Add bandit job as part of pep8 in tox.ini

Had to ignore assert check since those are use for performance in the
validation code. Also, skipped bandit checks of monasca_common/kafka_lib
since that is just a clone of kafka-python and will be deleted in the
future

Change-Id: Ie2e726a8e45ef463c4e863792eed663ee472ed07

The security guide suggests that service config files
should be owned by root and in the service user group with 0640 permissions.

The cve-assign@mitre.org email address is no longer in use for
requesting CVE IDs as of August 29, 2016. Instead a new process
using a web form has been implemented, learn more at:
https://cve.mitre.org/news/archives/2016/news.html#august292016_FOCUS_ON:_New_Method_to_Request_CVE_IDs_Updates_and_More_from_MITRE_in_Effect

'}]
commit_message:
Change CVE Request process

The cve-assign@mitre.org email address is no longer in use for
requesting CVE IDs as of August 29, 2016. Instead a new process
using a web form has been implemented, learn more at:
https://cve.mitre.org/news/archives/2016/news.html#august292016_FOCUS_ON:_New_Method_to_Request_CVE_IDs_Updates_and_More_from_MITRE_in_Effect

Change-Id: I2772c4a7fe0ebc22887a8b9a27f577480cbde74e

commit_message:
Bump minimum Tempest version

We(QA team) are releasing library interfaces for using common Tempest
code from the other projects by bumping Tempest version.
The latest Tempest contains new library interfaces, then this patch
increases the minimum version.

Change-Id: Ie45595b898a24e33d3d413b8b928f06b9e0df6d0

[{'number': 28, 'created': '2017-02-09 19:45:06.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/cmd/cli.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1642212-9964dfd3af0184bd.yaml', 'doc/source/upgrading.rst', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_sql_upgrade.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_cli.py'], 'message': 'Add --check to keystone-manage db_sync command

This patch adds a new command to the db_sync upgrade commands. --check
will check the current state of the users upgrade repos and relay info
back to the user based on what version each command is currently at and
if the user has any outstanding db_sync commands left to run. It will
also notify the user if the db_sync commands were not upgraded in order

Change-Id: I79d3640a780d624f14059fe311fafa0542c03357
'}]
commit_message:
Add --check to keystone-manage db_sync command

This patch adds a new command to the db_sync upgrade commands. --check
will check the current state of the users upgrade repos and relay info
back to the user based on what version each command is currently at and
if the user has any outstanding db_sync commands left to run. It will
also notify the user if the db_sync commands were not upgraded in order

Closes-Bug: 1642212
Change-Id: I79d3640a780d624f14059fe311fafa0542c03357

commit_message:
Don't use keystoneclient for auth_ref

We seem to be unnecessarily using keystone client for
auth_ref. Use get_access from auth_plugin instead.

This removes the properties auth_token and auth_ref from
keystone client wrapper.

Change-Id: I99cc89b6013a98dca4fcbf3840d5bb83afa6e3d5

don't need to make redundant requests to grab same data.
